sub_title: Senior (Agile) Project Manager bij McCoy & Partners
summary:
Mario is able to translate your challenge into an actionable plan and deliver the results, Mario is the right match for your challenge. Over the past 20 years he developed a sound track record, delivering SAP and non-SAP (IT) projects from 100k up to 3M euro. You can expect Mario to work according to his personal project approach: “Committed, focus on business value and a satisfied customer”.
Mario is an experienced (Agile) project manager and you can rely on him to manage your projects successfully, his IPMA-B project management certificate proves his track-record. He is open in his communication and brings structure, which helps you to make the right decisions. Mario is highly committed to achieve the business value for you and your customers. 
In his free time, Mario combines family life with sport. One of the sports that Mario does is Karate, where he also regularly helps the teacher to teach and coach the juniors. Mario enjoys coaching and helping people also during his work.

projects.title: MDG Business Partner (MDG-BP)
projects.description:
Project

Alliander has the ambition to create one central source for alle of their master data. They believe that it is crucial for their transition and it’s an enabler for other important programs like Fit4Future. This is the reason that Alliander started a new project called MDG-BP ( Master Data Governance for the object Business Partner). This is the next step in centralizing the data for business and IT. The scope of the project is to deliver high quality business partner (header) data in MDG.

Responsibilities

Mario was asked to manage this project on behalf of McCoy. Mario is managing the complete project from Prepare phase until now. The key challenges for Mario are: managing this project with stakeholders from several different business units within Alliander, managing this project with several Agile teams within a SAFe organization. From January until June 2023 Mario also had the role of product owner.

Results

This project is delivering the following key applications:

SAP S/4 Master Data Governance (MDG) for Business Partners;
Integration between SAP S/4 and SAP ECC;
Integration between SAP S/4 and SAP C4.

This project requires an agile approach, knowledge from the Alliander organization and SAP, structuring, planning, supporting / facilitating the others within the project. This project is still in progress.

projects.title: #Simplificatie / Fit4Future Central Finance Project
projects.description:
Project
The ambition of the #Simplification / Fit4Future program is to radically redesign the Business Processes and IT Application Landscape towards proven industry standards. The first 'lighthouse' project was Central Finance, to get the landscape moving and to provide maximal roadmap flexibility throughout the program. The scope of the project was to deliver a System of Report: Realtime data replication from SAP ECC to SAP S/4HANA of financial documents, control functions for Intercompany reconciliation and month end closing activities and consolidation of financial figures for external and managerial reporting.

Responsibilities
In January 2021 Mario was asked to manage this project on behalf of McCoy. Mario managed the design workshops based on the 'Fit-to-Standard approach. The key challenges for Mario were: managing this project within a new agile (SAFe) organization, new SAP S/4 system landscape, within tight timelines and based upon the SAP Activate approach. He managed the complete project from prepare until the aftercare phase.

Results
This project delivered the following key applications:
•	S/4HANA Cloud Extended 2020 SP01 (CFIN, ICMR light and Group Reporting);
•	Data Collection for Group Reporting;
•	S/4 Master Data Governance (MDG) for cost objects;
•	SAP Analytics Cloud.

This project required an agile approach, structuring, planning and building a good network within Alliander and that is what Mario did. Key for his success was his ability to facilitate the team and manage the project within the boundaries.

projects.title: #Simplificatie Inkoop
projects.description:
Project

The ambition of #Simplification program is to radically redesign the Business Processes and IT Application Landscape towards proven industry standards. One of the projects within this program is the Procurement project. Alliander is planning to implement the Ariba Contract Management module. The first step of this project is the design of the future best practice process and system set up.

Responsibilities

As project manager, Mario managed the design workshops based on the 'Fit-to-Standard approach. He managed the Prepare and Explore phase of the project (duration of involvement: 3 months, approx. 9 team members, > 8 stakeholders, budget + 60K euro).

Results

The deliverables that were produced by his team were: 1) Design document, 2) Target architecture, 3) Business Requirement Documents and Site Enablement workbook.

This project was based upon the SAP Activate process and 'Fit-to-Standard approach which should be aligned within the new Agile Alliander environment, within very tight timelines and that is what Mario did. Key for his success was his ability to facilitate the team and manage the project within the boundaries of the project and the agile organization.

Next step in the project is the actual implementation of the solution based on the best practice design. The actual start of this step is not determined yet.

contributors.headline: Senior (Agile) Project Manager bij McCoy & Partners

projects.title: DSM buy.SMART
projects.description:
Project

The objective of the DSM buy.SMART program was to optimize the procurement processes and systems. The first project of this program (phase 1) was to implement the SAP Ariba suite for a site in France and a couple of sites in Brazil. McCoy was responsible for the realization, integration and implementation of the Ariba Suite consisting of Upstream (SLP, S2C) and Downstream modules (Ariba Buying).

Responsibilities

In September of 2019 Mario was asked to manage this project on behalf of McCoy. The key challenges for Mario were the amount of stakeholders within the program, the tight timelines and the cooperation with several parties. He managed the design and the realization (duration of the project: 13 months, approx. 6/7 team members, >8 stakeholders, budget +930K euro).

Results

The project required focus, structure, commitment and building a good network within DSM and that is what Mario did. Mario initiated and managed this project. Key for his success was his strong focus on structuring the project and cooperation with the team and stakeholders.

projects.title: California - Business Apps
projects.description:
After the acquisition of Nuon assets Eneco decided to start the program California. The aim was to ensure that Eneco Warmte Utrecht (EWU) continues to run fully operational, but within the Eneco IT landscape. In this program I was responsible for the work stream “Business Apps”. Purpose of this work stream: make sure that all business applications are working, converted and available within Eneco. As project manager I managed three main projects. 
One of these projects was the project: “Sap AssetManagement Eneco (SAMEN2015)” in which we created a new template SAP Assetmanagement system, based upon requirements of two business units EWU and SBH-WKC. We also had too migrate all relevant Nuon data to Eneco SAP. We did this part of the project within 9 months using Agile (APM & SCRUM) methods and together with business and a very experienced number of SAP consultants.

The last half year I managed whole of the CalifIT programme as program manager

projects.title: BG-IT
projects.description:
The purpose of this project was the realisation and implementation of the IT backoffice for Bio Golden Raand (BGR). BGR is one of the largest bio mass factories within the Benelux. 
The main parts of the project were: host the Ultimo application on the central data centre, SAP implementation, realisation of an interface between SAP and Ultimo, realise the network between Eneco infra and BGR and onsite.
